column4: *help* one of my network cards does not work on dapper drake, but works fine on windows. I had to boot to windows to have my network up. I would appreciate any help.
what kind of network card is it?
RealTek
they are well supported in linux. What specific problem are you having?
I have two network cards.
neither work in ubuntu?
one of them is working fine. and other is detected as unknown device in ubuntu.
what does lspci tell you about the network card/
you might need to enable the module in your kernel.
lspci shows --> 0000:01:09.0 Ethernet controller: Realtek Semiconductor Co., Ltd. RTL-8139/8139C/8139C+ (rev 10)
they are both realtek?
no. I get the following info from WinXP -->    Description . . . . . . . . . . . : Realtek Rtl-8139d PCI Fast Ethernet
looks like CNet FAST200WL doesn't work.
does lsmod list a 8139too module?
yes it lists 8139too module.
does it list it as being used?
pastebin the output of lsmod | grep 8139too
lsmod result is in pastebin. http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/d17611
hrmm -- do you have mii-tools installed?
I don't see mii-tools in my synaptic. I see mii-diag and net-tools.
try mii-diag, forgot the exact name.
mii-diag tells 'eth0 failed: No such device'. More in pastebin http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/17612
try loading the 8139too module manually
